behavior.title: 1. Behavior in the Park and Towards Animals
behavior.content:
Park Nordica is a nature-oriented adventure park where wildlife roams in spacious enclosures or freely accessible areas. We urgently ask all guests to behave considerately and carefully – towards animals, nature, and fellow visitors.

Feeding, disturbing, or touching animals outside expressly designated areas (e.g., petting zoo) is strictly prohibited. Violations can lead to dangers for both animals and humans and may result in expulsion from the premises.

Parents and accompanying persons are responsible for supervising children. Children under 12 years may only enter the petting zoo area when accompanied by an adult.

Please stay on marked paths and follow staff instructions.

facilities.title: 2. Use of Facilities, Rides and Play Areas
facilities.content:
The use of our attractions is subject to observance of safety regulations, age or height restrictions, and all staff instructions.

No liability can be assumed for improper use or disregard of instructions. Damages resulting from incorrect use or misconduct are the responsibility of the visitor.

liability.title: 3. Disclaimer of Liability
liability.content:
Park Nordica is only liable in cases of intent or gross negligence. Further liability – particularly for damages caused by improper behavior of guests or disregard of safety instructions – is excluded.

We are not liable for:
• Accidents due to personal misconduct
• Loss or theft of personal belongings
• Weather-related restrictions or damages
• Damages due to force majeure (e.g., storms, pandemics, power outages)

We are not liable for technical malfunctions, system failures, or errors in online bookings through third-party providers (e.g., Stripe). Payment processing is handled by a certified payment service provider – we have no access to your payment data.

events.title: 4. Events
events.content:
Tickets are only valid on the booked date. Return or refund is not possible – exceptions apply for cancellations by us.

Staying during special events is only allowed in designated areas. Entering non-publicly accessible zones is prohibited and done at your own risk.

website.title: 5. Website Information
website.content: We strive to provide correct and current information. However, content (e.g., prices, opening hours) may change at short notice. We assume no liability for technical problems, data loss, or damages caused by viruses or third parties.

futureDetailedText:
It is with great regret that we must inform you that Park Nordica will not be open during the 2025 season. During this time, we are transforming the former family park with great passion and commitment into a completely renewed, modern, and nature-oriented adventure park.

Our goal is to create a safe, sustainable, and technically flawless environment – extensive renovation measures are necessary for this. Regular visitor traffic is unfortunately not possible during this construction phase.

We sincerely ask for your understanding and are already looking forward to welcoming you and your family to our park from June 2026 – in a park that awaits you with love for nature, innovative ideas, and new highlights.

previewDetailedText:
Sneak Peek on July 19th & 20th – A First Look Behind the Scenes

On July 19th and 20th, 2025, we will exclusively open selected areas of Park Nordica – and cordially invite you to a very special sneak peek weekend!

Experience firsthand what has already changed, take a first look at our new ideas, and join us for feedings of selected animals that take place at fixed times. When purchasing tickets, you can sign up for one of the feeding times to experience the animals up close and enjoy first encounters in the new park.

Please note: The number of visitors is strictly limited per day, as the park is still under construction and will only be partially opened.

Additionally, we invite you to enjoy hearty grilled snacks and non-alcoholic refreshments. Each ticket includes one food voucher and one drink voucher that can be redeemed on site.

We are particularly looking forward to welcoming guests from the Namdalen region, from Trøndelag, and beyond for this unique opportunity – to give you a first taste of the new Park Nordica experience.

Tickets are available now – while supplies last!
